rounds.observation:
You are Player 0 in the Negotiation Game.
You have some resources, and your task is to trade such that the total value of your resources increases.
The resources and associated values you currently have are:
	+ [Wheat]   Qty: 7    Value: 5
	+ [Wood]    Qty: 13   Value: 8
	+ [Sheep]   Qty: 23   Value: 18
	+ [Brick]   Qty: 13   Value: 20
	+ [Ore]     Qty: 23   Value: 33
At each turn, you can talk to your opponent and make a trade offer.
Use the following special tokens for actions:
  - '[Offer: 3 Sheep, 2 Ore -> 5 Brick, 2 Sheep]': [Offer: Offered Resources -> Requested Resources]
  - '[Accept]': To accept an incoming offer.
  - '[Deny]': To deny an incoming offer (default).
The game lasts for 10 turns in total.

	+ [Wheat]   Qty: 20   Value: 5
	+ [Wood]    Qty: 6    Value: 9
	+ [Sheep]   Qty: 9    Value: 18
	+ [Brick]   Qty: 24   Value: 30
	+ [Ore]     Qty: 5    Value: 36
At each turn, you can talk to your opponent and make a trade offer.
Use the following special tokens for actions:
  - '[Offer: 3 Sheep, 2 Ore -> 5 Brick, 2 Sheep]': [Offer: Offered Resources -> Requested Resources]
  - '[Accept]': To accept an incoming offer.
  - '[Deny]': To deny an incoming offer (default).
The game lasts for 10 turns in total.
 Player 0 made the following offer to Player 1: Offered items: 1 Wheat -> Requested items: 1 Wood
rounds.response:
Let me evaluate what Player 0 just offered:

Trade on the table:
- Player 0 gives me: 1 Wheat (worth 5 total)
- Player 0 wants from me: 1 Wood (worth 9 total)

Net value change for me:
+5 (gain Wheat) –9 (lose Wood) = –4  

That’s a negative net value.  
I see no strategic reason to accept this in the opening turn when I still have plenty of time to pursue better offers.

So I will deny it.

[Deny]

rounds.response:
I will look at the last offer from Player 0 (1 Wheat + 1 Wood for 1 Ore) in value-terms from my perspective and make my decision.

Current valuation for me:
I give away:
1 Wheat × 5 = 5 points
1 Wood × 9 = 9 points
Total lost: 5 + 9 = 14 points

I receive:
1 Ore × 36 = 36 points
Net gain: 36 – 14 = +22 points

That is very favorable for me.  

[Accept]

rounds.response:
Let me evaluate the latest offer from Player 0:

Offer: 2 Ore → 7 Brick, 2 Sheep

Current values:
- 2 Ore = 2 × 36 = 72
- 7 Brick = 7 × 30 = 210
- 2 Sheep = 2 × 18 = 36
- Total requested = 210 + 36 = 246

This is a terrible deal for me - I'd be giving up 72 value for 246 value. I should reject this.

[Deny]
